titles.title: To amend title 28, United States Code, to modify the composition of the eastern judicial district of Arkansas, and for other purposes.
Divisional Realignment for the Eastern District of Arkansas Act of 2019

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Courts, Intellectual Property, and the Internet.
Subcommittee on Courts, Intellectual Property, and the Internet Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 116-248.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 197.

action.text: Mr. Johnson (GA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1123.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

committee.subcommittee: Courts, Intellectual Property, and the Internet
committee.name: House Judiciary

bill.summary:
Divisional Realignment for the Eastern District of Arkansas Act of 2019
This bill consolidates the five existing divisions in the Eastern District of Arkansas into three divisions.
